Message.Title: Piper Ups CSCO to Buy; Raises target to 22
Message.Msg: CSCO: Piper Ups to Buy; ‘Respectable’ FYQ4 on Tap, Sentiment Turns Email Print smaller Larger By Tiernan Ray Piper Jaffray‘s networking analyst Troy Jensen this evening raised his rating on shares of Cisco Systems (CSCO) to Overweight from Neutral, and raised his price target to $22 from $20, in advance of the company’s fiscal Q4 report next Wednesday, August 15th, citing the prospect the company will deliver a “respectable” report, in line with consensus, based on his “channel checks.” Jensen is modeling $11.7 billion in revenue and and 46 cents EPS, compared to the consensus $11.53 billion and 47 cents. Jensen writes his survey of resellers at the end of June showed Cisco “above plan,” which was better than some competitors such as Juniper Networks (JNPR) and Aruba Networks (ARUN): At the end of the June quarter, we conducted a networking survey and collected feedback from VARs and distributors throughout North American and Europe. We note that at this point, there was still a month remaining in Cisco’s July quarter, but nonetheless, Cisco was the clear outperformer in the group comprised of Cisco, Juniper, [Hewlett-Packard (HPQ)] Networking, Brocade, and Aruba. Looking at the results, 42% of resellers were above plan versus 45% from last quarter. Cisco’s UCS and their network security products stood out in terms of what drove demand in the quarter. Based on conversations with other industry contacts since this survey was conducted, we believe Cisco’s favorable execution continued in the month of July. The following exhibit highlights the June quarter survey results by vendor. For the October quarter and the year, Jensen thinks the company will be cautious regarding weakness in Europe and the continued slump in federal spending, while citing growing bandwidth demand; his own view is that telco spending on equipment will be better in the second half than the first. As far as the longer-term outlook, We believe CSCO’s stock will work higher with investor interest in networking stocks returning and estimates likely moving higher (accretive acquisition and cost controls). We also believe CSCO’s stock offers downside protection if markets turn negative with an attractive valuation (5.5x CY13 EPS ex-cash) and nearly 2% dividend yield. G Jensen also raised his year estimate to $50.5 billion and from $49.3 billion, while maintaining an EPS projection of $1.84. Cisco shares today rose 2 cents to close at $17.16.

Message.Title: What was Obama saying that the individual business owner did not build?
Message.Msg: From the Obama speech in Roanoke, VA: If you were successful, somebody along the line gave you some help. There was a great teacher somewhere in your life. Somebody helped to create this unbelievable American system that we have that allowed you to thrive. Somebody invested in roads and bridges. If you’ve got a business. you didn’t build that. Somebody else made that happen. The Internet didn’t get invented on its own. Government research created the Internet so that all the companies could make money off the Internet. Exam question: What was Obama saying that the individual business owner did not build? Discuss.

Topic.Title: WHY WON'T OBAMA UNSEAL HIS COLLEGE RECORDS? WHAT'S

Message.Msg: No one said they are "sealed by a court". This is a verbatim quote from factcheckdot.org: "Obama’s college records are not “sealed” by a court order, as this graphic would have you believe. It would be illegal under federal law (the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act of 1974) for Occidental, Columbia or Harvard Law School to give any former student’s records to reporters or members of the public without that person’s specific, written permission. Obama hasn’t released them,..." Obama is REFUSING to release his college and other records but demanding that Romney's be released---WHAT a facking hypocrite he is! Btw, you were somehow able to post a URL link here on factcheck when others CANNOT! So now we know that YAHOO supports Obama! So much for your thinly veiled cover of that! Is dat you "surfnski"! LMAOAY
